answers.answer: I just went on the service Canada website and applied for maternity leave. I still haven't heard back from them. It takes awhile to actually get anywhere with it. I would apply soon.

Typically a doctor will not put you on maternity leave without a medical reason. I was put on maternity from my doctor at 29 weeks I have preeclampsia so it's something you can not play around with and I was diagnosed with GD I'm 32 weeks tomorrow and we are shooting to hold off delivering until my 37th week. Otherwise I would still be at work until I went into labor.
Maybe she can give you a note for "light duty"?
I agree. Can she put you on light duty? Doctors will not pull you out of work completely unless there is a medical reason. Definitely ask about light duty.
In CA you can get taken out of work at 36 weeks and collect state. That's what I did. Doctors take you out for pregnancy
Most of the time if you go out early that takes away fron the time after u have the baby u may want to look in to asking to be put on lite duty

I'm also 34 weeks 2 days,ive been on maternity leave for 3 weeks already due to bad SPD. Luckily I'm from the UK n you don't need a drs note to go on leave. I feel for you,even if I didnt have the SPD there would be no way I could do a job which involved hard labour now. You need to demand to be put on light duties at least!good luck!

My workplace is rediciouls. Its like a sweat shop..seriously...I do not plan on staying here after I have the baby that is forsure. I am already on light duty but its still very hard. I have two herniated disks in my lower back along with a shifted spine. The shooting pain goes down my legs its bad. I work in time from 7am - 330pm sometimes 5pm or even 7am-7pm!! Then going home and doing house work! It gets very exhausting. I have mentioned this all to my dr but she said bc my BP isnt high she cant take me out.  I'm from MA by the way
